Reviews.Title: “Modest, clean, quiet...and the price is right”
Reviews.Author: montreal7565
Reviews.Content: Clean, pleasant, no-frills hotel . Excellent location : near skytrain and frequent buses. Short walk to seawall and lovely bike/pedestrian path with spectacular view of false creek and mountains. 15 min walk to granville island. Many stores and restaurants in the area. Safe; pleasant and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “great location......but”
Reviews.Author: bctraveler_8
Reviews.Content: Location to hospital is great. Rooms were ok...nothing special but average. Biggest complaint is having my drivers licence photocopied. I have stayed at dozens of hotels and have NEVER had this done. When i asked the manager about this i was told it was manditory and could not stay unless i agreed to tis. Very rude manager.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: MariahIreland
Reviews.Content: Hotel really met our needs as it was very close to the hospital and other amenities. The staff were courteous and helpful. The rooms were were well presented and cleanliness was to a high standard. We met a lovely Polish lady who serviced the rooms and she was a real lady. We were on the 6th. floor. There is a nice restaurant attached to the hotel. I would definitely stay there again. Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay Just as Great as the First - Medical trip”
Reviews.Author: daisychar1
Reviews.Content: Our first stay was great, we stayed on the 5th floor and the room was quite spacious and very clean with 2 double beds and a very nice closet as well as a coffee pot & fridge. We enjoyed the stay very much. Check in was smooth and we were able to check in a little early which was nice. Our second stay was great as well. We stayed on the 4th floor the hotel was fully booked so we weren't able to check in early but we were able to drop our bags at the hotel (no charge) and when we did check in everything went smoothly. We ordered room service and it was great!! Very fast and fresh! If you are heading down for a medical trip it is in the perfect location, with in walking distance to the Canada Line stop that takes you directly to the airport, close to hospitals, & restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise Find - Awesome View!!”
Reviews.Author: Jedavan
Reviews.Content: I only had one night in Vancouver and grabbed this hotel as it was close to my meeting. It used to be a tired old Ramada that I wouldn't be caught dead in. Based on the pictures I thought I'd give it a try and wow - what a neat surprise. While completely renovated, the rooms are nice, clean although a little small (especially the bathrooms which have barely enough room to turn). The real prize here is the view as it has a panoramic view of Vancouver including the full city, mountains and False Creek. If you're looking for a high end hotel with spacious bathrooms ... move on. But, if you're looking for a boutique type hotel with spectacular views, good service and great value, I'd say give this one a try.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but very close to hospital”
Reviews.Author: Jellybean055
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for almost two weeks due to medical emergency. You can't get much closer to Vancouver General Hospital than the Park Inn. The hotel was nothing special to write about, location was key, and it was clean. It looked like they had done some updating in the room, but not a complete overhaul. The staff was very accomodating & understanding of our issues. The hotel is across from the main emergency entrance of the hotel. We didn't check out the restaurant or any ammenities,so can't comment on those. The cleaning staff was great, one lady in particular noticed my mom didn't look very good one day & stopped her to see if she was ok, and proceeded to ask her every time she saw her how things were going. I wish I had gotten her name! Anyway, as we are from a small town & thrown into the big city at the worst possible time, it was so nice to see a friendly face once in awhile! Only downside was it being so close to the hospital (emergency in particular) you have to deal with the ambulances & the helicopter at all hours! But you can't have everything!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ellen M
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the room - the hotel has a fridge in every room, so this was a real help since I tend to buy my own food rather than eat out while traveling if I have the option. I stayed for three nights. Room was clean and comfortable. Wish the lighting were better. Everything is now lit by the new florescent coil style bulbs which project a harsh light, especially in the bathroom. Some of these bulbs offer a warmer cast, but these tend to be more expensive. I also wish the heater had been quieter. It was just beyond the foot of the bed. I finally turned it off at night so I could sleep in peace. When it ran it was loud and the curtain above it would balloon outward about two feet. The curtain was impossible to pull all the way to the side and keep it there. It would slowly gravitate to its original position and billow out again. A tie or sash added to the side would fix this annoyance without too much cost or hassle. Overall I enjoyed my stay. Across the street was a 24 hour Shoppers Drug Mart and there are an array of good cafes in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor attitude from check in staff at noisy insecure hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MaxsSunshineTour
Reviews.Content: I am a priceline customer and thought that we had yet another good deal thru them. We have stayed at some fantastic hotels before and had wonderful service but this "welcome" at the awful Park Inn really takes the biscuit. I was so incensed by the hostile welcome of the front desk staff that I actually wrote the review this from our room on the first night of our stay! We arrived after a 300 mile drive to the hotel to find that the rear car park was occupied by an unfortunate homeless man begging for money. Inside the hotel we be greeted by a five minute line up and two members of staff "serving other customers". I witnessed very poor customer service while I was waiting to be served and I was amazed at the lack of discretion and sympathy involving another customer in front of me. There was no warmth, empathy or welcome and I thought that this was a very unfriendly hotel. I finally got to the front of the line and a new member of staff came to the desk. I explained that we were staying for 2 nights and that we had made 2 bookings. This seemed to throw the receptionist, who made a big fuss about seeing whether it was possible to retain the same room throughout our two day stay. She eventually agreed and asked for a credit card and photo id. I produced an american express card with my photo on it and was immediately told that this was not sufficient to prove my identity. She abruptly told me that she wanted my driving licence as the photo id on american express wasn't sufficient. She then issued me a key for room on the first floor and sent me on my way. Not a smile. Not a "How's your day going?". Not an acknowledgement that she was pleased that we were staying with the Park Inn and Suites. Not a welcome..more a non verbal display of hostility towards customers who were interfering with her day by turning up and asking to be booked in. Turns out that the room was just around the corner from reception and opposite an open fire door leading to the car park, where I had parked my car prior to booking in. The door to our room was wedged open prior to our arrival and we entered to find a scruffy twin room with poor furnishings and antiquated beds. My wife sat on the bed and found that it was in very poor condition. The room was so scruffy that we had to have a good look around to check whether it had been burglarized prior to our arrival. We decided that there was no way that we could stay in that room and I exited thru the open fire door to move our vehicle before we negotiated another room. I secured the fire door as the homeless person was hanging around immediately outside. When I joined my wife at the front desk a third member of staff was dealing with my wife and I arrived just in time to hear the receptionist say, "If you book with priceline your choice of room is restricted". Sadly this receptionist also obviously believed that her customers were a major inconvenience in her life because she chose to be abrupt, off hand and rude. At this point I pointed out that the room was sub standard and that it was unlocked. My wife suggested that the homeless man could have easily entered the insecure room and that it was unsatisfactory. Amazingly the receptionist then decided to lecture us that all major cities had problems with homeless people and that we have to put up with it. She then told us that the cleaning staff had a policy of wedging open the firedoors and leaving the hotel room doors open for their own convenience. She seemed to completely miss the point that the safety and security of the hotel and guests should have been a priority for the staff. She finally gave us a better room but only if we paid an extra $20 upgrade fee. Prior to doing this she berated us as she had to change our parking to two days as we hadn't been told that we were staying longer than the initial booking. She was less than pleased when we pointed out that the initial receptionist had been apprised of that fact only five minutes previously. The bottom line is that our second room is perfectly adequate but we feel that the hotel treats its guest as though they are second rate citizens. Okay we are priceline customers but we do stay in hotels at least once a week on average. This place has been completely let down by three members of their front desk. All of them need to understand that customer service is paramount and that priceline customers do exchange information with their peers!

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: gottagetoutofhereBc
Reviews.Content: Good experience, friendly staff, $148 tax incl with breakfast for two and free parking. Nice view of downtown. Bus right outside door got us downtown in 10minutes. Exellent restuarnts in area, banana leaf was great. Everything rigtht there, drugstore, shops, beer store. Room was clean with a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Really tired but staff were aware of our lateness Royal Columbia”
Reviews.Author: Klindatheau1972
Reviews.Content: We just walked in and found it to fit the needs required to stay there. We were too tired to hear the ambulances... just got in an went too sleep. When we work up it was awesome to see the view of Vancouver... mind you there was a homeless dude sleeping at the Shoppers drug mart. There was a timmies across the street, and tons of places up an down the street. All in all a Lotus land visit. loved it... stayed November 19th, 2011. Parking is reasonable at $12.00

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: P&ZH
Reviews.Content: Didn't know what to expect given its' 2.5 star rating but it turned out well. Room was clean and well maintained. Great view, close to VGH and Canada line. Lots of restaurants in the area and within walking distance to Granville island. Arrived before noon and I was able to get an early check in. Rate was ok at $115. Problem free, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pat C
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and offered us helpful recommendations regarding local restaurants and attractions. The room was clean and the view spectacular. It being a hotel on a major artery, the street noise is significant. Wearing earplugs took care of this problem. The hotel appears well run and the staff was professional. All in all, a great stay. We will gladly stay at the Park Inn & Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: melmcg
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positive...fantastic view of the city...great desk staff...that's where it ends. This hotel could be fantastic and charge so much more...but it is barely worth the overpriced price I paid...and it was a medical discount. The hotel claims to be non-smoking...well it hasn't been for long. As soon as I stepped onto the 5th floor I could tell there had been smoker here lately...and it appears in MY room. Not only a smoker...but a avery distinct urine smell. The laminate wood floor in the entrant is separated...greasy smears on the armiour door (if its not grease...I wasn't checking to see what it was), and urine-like yellowness at the first...and second pour into the tub. The beds are 'not bad' but with the street noise...it wouldn't matter how great they were.

Reviews.Title: “Great place near the hospital for those early morning appointments”
Reviews.Author: jsbVancouver
Reviews.Content: The rooms are okay, but if you are fortunate enough to have a room overlooking Broadway, the view of Vancouver with the North Shore mountains in the background are one of the best you'll ever see! Be there for a late summer blood-red sunset as it reflects off the glass walls of downtown Vancouver - gorgeous! And, if you are very, very lucky, you will be treated to Jonathan, a server (usually the only one!) in the hotel's restaurant. He is worth the wait for the surprisingly very good food as he is extremely entertaining, especially if people order more than the cook might be able to handle (listen how Jonathan talks people out of ordering so much food! He had the whole place laughing). One hint - the menu offers far too many choices. The cook/chef should cut it down to about 12 or 15 selections rather than the hundreds which are now offered. We'll definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view”
Reviews.Author: camihayes
Reviews.Content: It is perhaps my favorite view of Vancouver (city-scape and mountains). Also the rooms are very nice and the staff are professional. I've given them repeated business when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “So - so.”
Reviews.Author: hatlad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night while hosting an evening event. First the guest room: Street side offers nice views of harbor and downtown. Even has a little step-out-balcony to aid in enjoying the view/taking pictures of the downtown highrises across the bay.. BUT, that side's rooms get a LOT of street noise from Broadway. If a light sleeper, suggest as high-rise floor as possible or non-street-side room. But, no real issues with the guest room. Main floor meeting/conference room carpet needs re-stretched - BAD. Many ripples in the carpeting. And when we arrived in early afternoon there were 3 portable fans going in the conference room and were there throughout our event. Really? Seriously? They weren't too noisy, but that's needed for circulation? Hello. Sounds like the HVAC system in the conference room needs replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Definately going to stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: Cassidy P
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we needed for our stay in Vancouver. It isn't in the 'highrise' part of town, but offers the best view of the city. It was close enough to UBC to make the trip to and from the campus tour short and hassle free. There are pleanty of great dining options right on broadway, and a lovely waterfront park just a short walk from the hotel. The hotel was clean, the staff was helpful, and the rooms were nothing too fancy, but they were comfortable. The street is a little noisy at times because of the street cars, but it is well worth the location, view, and stay. I will definately be staying here next time I visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Deposit Alert!”
Reviews.Author: Jaybee8008
Reviews.Content: The location is good but, customers should be aware of the deposit on your credit card or debit card...The hotel will put a hold on your card 200% of what is supposed to be charged of your entire stay in their hotel!!! They did it to me, they will do it to you too! We stayed 2 days, paid $365.32 but the hold that they put on my debit/atm card was $600+++ which has compromised some pre-scheduled payments back home. So be alert, change your charge card to a card that has more money in it, ask the front desk clerk how much money they held as deposit, otherwise, when you get back home, you will be surprise on charges on your card!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RocknRolla12
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay here. No problems that I can think of. I chose it due to location downtown and the stay didnt dissapoint. nice clean room, no noise despite being downtown, and had a spectacular view of the city. Will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate inn, clean, friendly, good location, free internet”
Reviews.Author: parmantom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 4 night business trip, the venue on arrival doesn't instill huge confidence and equally the rooms and overall style could be described as adequate. However for the price, the hotel does everything you would want, the rooms are a reasonable size, there is little noise, rooms have all the usual facitilities, service is friendly and helpful. Nothing stands out to make a complaint, and in the crazy august week when hotel rooms were scarce I would return here for a no-fuss easy stay. The hotel is near (12 mins walk) the airport train which extends into downtown Vancouver is convenient and return to the airport is super easy. it is on additional bus routes and the surrounding streets are full of cafe's, restaurants and a few shops including wholefoods and other decent food shops. a good choice - the cafe downstairs is quite average however - but so many options are outside this isnt a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great proximity to VGH”
Reviews.Author: KDVictoria
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its proximity to Vancouver General Hospital. The room is adequate and fairly well kept. The bathroom, however, was in need of repair and was not very clean - the bathroom door was sticky! The doors slam shut loudly and there was a lot of noise from the hallway and the room above us, but luckily it was very quiet at night. The heater/AC unit also make a lot of white noise which helps. I was surprised by how comfortable the beds and pillows were. One big downside is there is only one elevator for the whole hotel. Room service was fast and the food was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room with beautiful downtown view, convenient to SkyTrain”
Reviews.Author: sodomojo
Reviews.Content: Went to Vancouver on a quick shopping & sight-seeing trip. At check-in they seemed to be switching their computer system, so they were unable to issue me a room key. Housekeeping met me at the room to let me in. It was all sorted out later in the afternoon. Hotel is just a few blocks from the Broadway/City Hall stop on the Canada Line, so easy access to Amtrak & downtown proper. 4th floor room had a beautiful view of downtown and ski areas beyond. Traffic noise did not bother as I slept like a baby. There are numerous restaurants and coffee shops nearby. I did not try the hotel's restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: BcLouie
Reviews.Content: It was close to VGH and convienient for my medical appointment. I was on the back side so it was quiet although the medical helicopter did come in during the night- but it was OK- after all it is near the hospital. The room was very clean, it was nice to have a fridge, microwave, and a big closet. The TV set was great. Arrival and departure went very efficiently- all staff were very pleasant and informative! There were alot of shops on Broadway and the bus system was good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ianmc99
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Park Inn on Broadway during the July long weekend for a family function. This was our first ever trip to Vancouver and was not sure on what to expect. Check-in was supposed to be at 3pm but our flight wasn't delayed and getting from the airport to the hotel was quicker than expected. The front desk was friendly and advised us that our room was ready and got an early check-in. I would say around 1pm. We reserved a king bed room and didn't pay extra for the front view. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. They also had a big flat screen tv somewhere between the 37"-42" range. There was also 2 free bottles of water waiting in the fridge. The bathroom was clean and the water pressure was amazing. Based on some of the previous reviews I was expecting a noisy stay. I did request a quiet room and am happy to report that there was hardly any noise at the rear of the building. The housekeeping staff were very friendly as well. This location was great for Granville island and a 5-10 minute walk to the Skytrain station. The Tim Horton's across the street was convenient as well.

Reviews.Title: “good location with view of downtown”
Reviews.Author: Sanju06
Reviews.Content: the station is four blocks away. Mart is just across the street. staff is very friendly and helpful.there is no walkway or garden in the property. Rooms and the hotel is clean. Free wifi in hotel rooms is available .Also fridge , microwave and iron and coffee machine in room which can help in warming up the food in the rooms. Higher floor recommended with road side for a good view of city

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dixiebelle
Reviews.Content: My Sister, Mom and I recently stayed at this Hotel. Our reason for booking this one was because of closeness to the Vancouver General hospital. My mom was booked for surgery there. Its a lovely clean hotel. It is close to good restaurants, close to the skytrain and very close to the hospital. we had a room facing downtown Vancouver.. so exciting as we were there for the first game of the stanley cup finals. If you like sleeping with the window open you might want a room on the quiet side of the hotel as West Broadway is a noisy street at all hours of the night. You are only about 2 k from the skytrain station which will pretty much take you anywhere you want to go. Our vehicle didnt move from the parking stall as it was much easier then driving. Hotel was extremely clean and staff was friendly and helpful. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate budget hotel, except for two things”
Reviews.Author: Gertie1325
Reviews.Content: A perfectly adequate budget hotel, with two exceptions: 1. Some of the front desk staff need a little polish; and 2. The hotel copies and retains your picture ID, a policy that is deemed unnecessary and inappropriate by the Office of the Privacy Commissioner for Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to VGH”
Reviews.Author: Murraya
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to be close to the hospital. It is an older hotel but the room was clean and comfortable. Our room faced the street and the traffic was noisy. Overall an OK visit.

Reviews.Title: “One Hell of a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Haideagleprince
Reviews.Content: The Park Inn on West Broadway is one " Hell of a place to stay. " I travel to Vancouver every three months to stay and they do have a great place to stay. The rooms are clean, every room has a balcony view and as for sleep, if you get a room in the back it might be okay or a room higher then the 3rd floor will prompt a good sleep. As Vancouver General Emergency is in the back up one block, you may have to get use to the blariing sirens of ambulances all night and all day. It is still a nice place to stay. Everyday at a certain time they put out fresh apples for customers and you get a fresh bottle of water everyday in your room. A newspaper deivered every morning, and the staff are very cordial and take care of your needs if they can.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant discovery in an underrated neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: happycamper15
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller to Vancouver and just recently discovered the Broadway area and the Park Inn. If you have been to Vancouver before, branch out to this area. It is very close to the city core but has a much more relaxed and friendly atmosphere. There are dozens of independant and affordable restaurants in this area, including the famous Banana Leaf. This hotel is small but offers everything that I need at half the price of a downtown hotel. They don't nickle & dime you here. Parking is cheap and Wifi is free, The staff are friendly and helpful. They offered great advice about exploring this neighborhood and about the easy transportation options nearby. Pay the small surcharge for the city view rooms. You wil get the postcard image of Vancouver that you can't see when you stay downown. The rooms are clean and modern with great bedding. Broadway can be a bit noisy but all city hotels will have some noise. The website was good but I had some trouble with it and got an even better price when I called the tollfree number. I have never heard of the Park Inn chain before but will check them out for other travels.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jakey10
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with clean rooms and very helpful staff. Although not in the centre of Vancouver it was very easy to get around the city using their excellent public transport system. Ask reception about the 'Day Pass' tickets. Good in house restaurant for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Junedog
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a web discount site, and got a terrific value. This is not a fancy hotel, but rooms were very clean and spacious. Location is great--just south of the downtown, not quite so hectic, whith a 24 hour drug store across the street and wonderful restaurants in the same block. My partner was sick while we were there, and the staff was very helpful. Rooms have a microwave and fridge. They even tuck a few bottles of water in the fridge every day for free. We slept like babies, even with a streetside room, When we go back to Vancouver, we'll stay here again. Make sure you ask for a room with a view of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Decent value though the walls have ears...”
Reviews.Author: homeguyDOTorg
Reviews.Content: Very easy to hear what is going on in the halls and in the rooms down the halls, other than that it was a very clean and updated building, staff for the most park was friendly. The only real negative is there was only 1 elevator, so be prepared to wait as the staff has to use it from floor to floor as well. Good over all though, ps thermostat on the wall controls the air ha ha

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: lailbale
Reviews.Content: We had two nights at Park Inn and Suites and found it very comfortable. Small bathrooms but adequate. Air con was rather noisy so we did not use it. Lovely view of the city from our room. Runner, cycle and step in the gym. Good location with regular buses outside; short walk to the sky train. Lots of different restaurants nearby. We used the Market Cafe located in the Park Inn for our children as it had a very good selection of children's meals.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the bedding”
Reviews.Author: Gazell23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in Jan for business and I loved it. My room was very nice, the staff was very friendly and I really loveed the bedding. I would definetely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: smarterwear
Reviews.Content: If you really want to see just what type of people you shouldn't hire to greet the public then this is the place for you. With all of the unemployment today, you would think that you could find someone who's more suitable to greet the public. As I read through other reviews of the hotel, this was a common complaint regarding the hotel. I can only think that the manager must have hired his relatives to fill these positions as they seem so horribly ill suited for such work.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, good sized, skytrain within walking distance”
Reviews.Author: mozza64
Reviews.Content: Small sized hotel, friendly hotel staff. Room booked was 2 double beds - small but not cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbug Alert- Avoid at All Costs”
Reviews.Author: sensfantoronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel had bedbugs Free high-speed wireless advertised- non-existent Rude, incompetent fron-desk staff

Reviews.Title: “Ffantastic Staff!”
Reviews.Author: jewelNewYork
Reviews.Content: The shortcomings the room had (very small bathroon, limited storage for clothes, etc.) was more than made up for by the wonderful staff. Everyone was extremely helpful with information on what sights to see and how to go about getting there. Jola of housekeeping, Janice of the cafe were always going out of their way to accommodate us. The desk staff called for cabs and dinner reservations for us-also very patient when helping us to checkin and printout our airline boarding passes, as we were not very computer savy. We have never experience such a warm and friendly hotel staff! The view from our North room balcony was breathtaking! The location of the hotel was close to buslines. Would definitely recomment this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: LydVictoria
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel while in Vancouver to visit our son. We like the look of the hotel and the staff were very professional and friendly. The room was clean, but did need some updating. Bed spread was a bit dated. I see in other photos that some of the rooms have had more updating than ours. Our main complaint other than the beds were just a bit too firm for us was the noise level from the hallways. The door to the hallway is a solid core fire door, but I gather there was carpet up to the door in the room previously so the door does not go all the way to the floor. Every little noise in the hallway feels like it is right there in the room with you. The friendly chamber maid staff can be heard all the way down the hall along with any door closing and they do close loudly. The plumbing woke us up at 4 a.m. None of the things we had issues with can be fixed quickly so we didn't mention them to the staff. We loved that the location was walking distance to many shops and restaurants. We were at the back of the hotel so the street noise wasn't an issue and "most" of the ambulances going to Vancouver General Hospital Emergency (seen from our window) remembered to turn their sirens off before going up the street next to the hotel. Likely won't stay here again, but I can see that it would be good for many other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value for dollar”
Reviews.Author: Caro281
Reviews.Content: My husband, baby and I stayed here just over a week ago as we needed to visit BC Children's Hospital. It is very close to Childrens, BC Women's, and Vancouver General. Lots of places to eat within walking distance and very close to the downtown core (I wouldn't walk it personally but it is close enough to do). We were there during their seismic upgrades which made it inconvenient to unload and load the vehicle with all our stuff. There is underground parking that does not have an elevator to the inside which is invconvenient and there is outdoor parking around back which you have to navigate stairs or go out the alley to carry your suitcases in. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. I couldn't get into my room as the handle was stuck and the repair men came immediately upstairs to fix it. We did find there was the smell of cigarette smoke on our floor although smoking is not allowed. We found morning and night were the worst for the smell and mentioned it to the front desk and they said they would get right on it. I suspect someone was smoking on the balcony with the door open which blew the smoke right under the door into our room. The rooms were very clean except there was some small stuff on the floor that my baby managed to find and pick up. My baby can find anything microscopic on the floor so I wouldn't say they were dirty. This hotel has recently been renovated inside and it is well done. There is a small cafe inside the hotel which we had our breakfast the one morning. The food was alright but one particular waitress wasn't so friendly. I asked if I could order just one piece of toast for my baby (anytime I've asked in the past at restaurants they always oblige and don't charge me for it even though I'm willing to pay) and she told rudely, "We only sell them in two's". Huh? You mean you can't order one piece of toast and charge me half the price? Is that too hard? Other than that our experience was good and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Some Problems -- Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Forest20851
Reviews.Content: I know the Park Inns. There's a big one at London-Heathrow and also one I've stayed in near Minneapolis airport. They give good value for the dollar--usually. And I know that construction for the new Vancouver subway is two blocks away. But I was lucky enough to hit this particular hotel during 'seismic upgrading' -- adding additional steel and concrete to the underground parking garage to pass new local regulations. So jackhammers ran from 9am to 4pm, though I was out a good part of that time. And the hotel does own other parking space in the neighborhood for our rental cars and such. To be honest, I had to Febreeze my room. I recognized the stench--my 'non-smoking' room **used to be** a 'smoking' room. Okay, no big deal. I got a good rate. The maids befriended me. They gave me extra bottled water, extra coffee packs for my Mr. Coffee machine, and extra towels. I can't guarantee they will do that for everyone. Okay, now for the one *big* problem. (drumroll please!) My room faces south (away from the fantastic views) and I am facing Vancouver General Hospital. Helicopters--bringing patients to the regional shock-trauma unit--land on the annex roof opposite my balcony door any time of the day or night. All in all, I'm going to let construction settle down around here before I pay a return visit here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value modern hotel, but very poor soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: majikthise
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Inn & Suites on Broadway for 4 nights. The hotel is a new building, with a car park underneath, and there are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. It is within a 20 minute walk of Granville Island and Kitsilano, and although this hotel is not centrally located (you'd need to catch a bus to get to downtown), it offers good value for Vancouver, which is not a cheap place to stay. The rooms are modern, well-designed, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was clean, but very small. The big problem with this hotel is the noise - although the view from the rooms on the street side is spectacular across Vancouver to the mountains beyond, there must have been a big gap or a vent somewhere around the window, because although the window was closed, the busy street outside was very loud - I would recommend requesting a room on the back side of the building if you want a quiet night's sleep - but even with a room at the back, you will still have the problem of a large gap at the bottom of the door, which means you can hear everything going on in the corridor that runs along the centre of each floor. Bring earplugs! Car parking in the area around the hotel is tightly controlled, but it only costs $8 per 24hrs to park in the hotel's car park. This hotel does not have a restaurant. Wireless internet is free, and there is one PC for guest use in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “View is worth it!”
Reviews.Author: muddypuppy
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here & were quite pleased with the hotel. We had a room on the top floor facing the city. The view was amazing! However streetside, there is a lot of noise, but I was ok with that. The hall doors are thin so you can hear people in the hallway & the doors bang shut so that can be annoying. Check in was ok. the lobby is nothing special. I didn't even bother checking out the hotel restaurant, what for...you're in Vancouver!!! Go out! The room was beautiful, a little crammped but I didn't mind, and the bed was comfortable. Nice room overall. I thought the location was ideal. You are on a main bus line so can get wherever you want quickly. Plus there are so many nice places within walking distance. What's also fun is to walk down to the creek & grab one of the little boat ferries which will take you across to downtown, over to granville island, or to english bay. I think it's the same price as the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: stevieboy027
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the park inn for three week so far this summer while on business. I chose this Hotel due to its location even though I wanted to stay at a higher rated hotel. I was pleasantly surprised with my first week in the hotel. So much so I booked it for two more consecutive weeks. The room was not bad. A little small, but comfortable. The views of downtown Vancouver, the inner harbour and the mountains were simply breathtaking. Everything you could want is located not just nearby but within a stones throw. Tim Horton's, Wendy's, a cold beer store, a very pleasant pub and several Canadian and ethnic restaurant's. Free high speed wireless Internet is rare at hotels here in Vancouver, but is included at the Park inn. Room service is fast and the food is very good. Overall my stay there was very nice and was disappointed when I couldn't get a room here for my next trip. However I will Book earlier next time. I recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine and loved the eggs benedict”
Reviews.Author: fionnualag
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late and very tired good efficient reception and comfortable room. A bit noisy which they warned us about. Everything you need is provided including a microwave. Next day enjoyed breakfast but girl on desk very vague about everything and we ended up setting off with no idea where we were going - serendipity. Found Granville Island -found little boats -result gorgeous day. Snacked all day so bypassed all the restaurants and there are plenty. Went into pub - left fairly hastily. Shops etc around so all very handy. Tried to leave some books behind to lighten luggage but helpful cleaner came all the way downstairs with them! One warning - when we were leaving and the previous day there were lots of unhappy people checking out and complaining that their bills were much higher than they had been quoted. I don't know if it is the taxes added later but one lady was very distressed so if I were booking it independently I'd get the real story or at least written confirmation of rate.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but very satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: NewportJC
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, comfortable beds, and easy to reach. No, you're not downtown, but the bus system in Vancouver is quite extensive and with a bus stop right in front of the hotel we were able to get everywhere we wanted to go quickly with a minimum of hassle. No problems, no regrets about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: stitchsmom
Reviews.Content: We paid extra money to get a king or queen bed, when we went to our room it was two doubles. When we went back to the lobby they said there was nothing they could do for us. The phone service was not able to take any messages. I got several bug bites. There were sirens all night long in front of the hotel and at one point in the middle of the night we got awoken up by someone screaming.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price in a safe area”
Reviews.Author: chrisnoc
Reviews.Content: My traveling friend booked the room through an agency and we were both quite pleased with the hotel. The location was good and convenient since we had a car but it is not downtown and would require taking a taxi or using public transportation to get around otherwise. The room was a nice size, well appointed and clean. The bathroom was upscale with a marble vanity and tile. The room came with both a microwave and a small fridge which came in handy. The hotel parking garage was convenient but pretty cramped and the cost ($8 CAD per day) was average. I did not eat in the hotel restaurant but my friend did and said it was good and average cost. There are several restaurants, coffee shops, fast food and a drugstore within a block or two walk. We were on the first floor facing the street so there was some street noise but as long as the balcony door was closed it was fine. The HVAC unit worked fine as well. It would be much nicer higher up with a view of downtown and the mountains but the hotel was booked up and we arrived too late to score one of the higher floors. They have a small workout room but I didn't check it out. The hotel personnel were friendly but didn't go out of their way to be helpful. They were able to provide some cash exchange for us so we could pay for parking elsewhere, etc. Overall it was a great stay and I would recommend it and stay there again if I had a car with me.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Scooby353
Reviews.Content: Noisy. Booked a twin room which I presumed meant two beds when I arrived I was told a twin room was one kingsize bed, had to end up sleeping on a pull-out portable bed (not comfortable). Charged twice on my credit card, still waiting on this to be sorted.

Reviews.Title: “Not Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: ezzepeeze
Reviews.Content: Overall a lousy experience. Staff and management were not helpful. Location and room were not great. Lobby was filthy. Opted to go to Dennys rather than eat at the dirty restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ste1963
Reviews.Content: Very well priced.Rooms are clean and reasonably updated.Bed is comfortable.Bathroom is simple but nice. Air conditioner is quiet and modern.Only negative is the loud closing front door to the room,keep the air on and you won't be bothered.

Reviews.Title: “Agreed about the rude staff!”
Reviews.Author: oneblueh
Reviews.Content: This being my third trip to Vancouver, I've run into nothing but friendly locals and enjoyed my stays thoroughly. I had the unfortunate luck of getting this hotel through Priceline, however, and was disappointed by several things. The location is not ideal, but more importantly, the front desk staff was incredibly rude. When we arrived after 5:00 pm, we were told that our room still wasn't ready (check-in was at 3:00 pm). When I asked what would have happened if we had arrived on time for check-in, they said they would have found another room for us, but claimed they were also sold out. ??? Later, on check-out, there were two women working up front and when I chose to go to the one standing right in front of me, the other rolled her eyes at me with disgust. She then tried to charge my friend an additional $14. When my friend asked what the charge was for, the woman stood there and just stared at her like she should know already. It turns out that she pulled up the wrong room instead. I was highly disappointed in this desk staff and will not be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the hotel very much”
Reviews.Author: gaucho5
Reviews.Content: We got this thru Hotwire. We really enjoyed the hotel. They called 10 minutes after check-in to see if everything was all right. I left my lights on my car; and they called our room to notify us. It is very close to downtown. There's a Wendy's & Tim Horton's across the street. I definitely would stay here again especially for tthe hotwire price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: rsv
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Vancouver and we are glad we stayed at Park Plaza. We stayed there for four nights. The rooms were extremely clean and the view from our 5th floor room was absolutely fantastic. The staff was extremely helpful and the location was fabulous. Every attraction we wanted to go was within a 15-20 minute drive. The variety of food in the vicinity was unbelievable and all of them were within a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel was renovated recently and the room had a refrigerator and microwave. We requested two double beds and the room was spacious enough to accomodate the four of us. I really don't have anything negative to say about the hotel (except for the SLOW elevator). For the record, we paid $139 for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small, website is deceiving”
Reviews.Author: JulieFangKoo
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at this Park Plaza this weekend. The hotel is OK. Yes, it looks like it has been newly renovated. However it is much smaller than the pictures leads you to think. Our room was on the 6th floor (highest floor) facing the street. You could hear some street noise, but it wasn't bad. The staff was pretty nice but not knowledgeable. However when we asked for breakfast suggestions - they told us there was nothing nearby except an A&W at the end of the block. We then found 3 places on the same block that served breakfast, and A&W was on another block. We had a king room. It was small. The bathroom was REALLY small - it was a one person bathroom. Ventilation could've been better - the fan in the bathroom didn't do much. There was an air conditioner unit in the room - which I thought was outdated, most hotels should have central air! We probably wouldn't stay here again. We probably will try the Holiday Inn down the same street - pretty much the same price, but rooms are better, I think. We paid $160/night - which I thought was pricey for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “Room OK, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ramada on Broadway in late November while I was in town to get laser surgery on my eyes. This was the closest hotel to the clinic and at $85/night seemed a reasonable option. I won't be back. The room was nicely furnished but very cold and the thermostat didn't work at all. The lobby is being renovated and the way to the elevators is through an open construction zone which was inconvenient and the rude desk staff didn't offer directions until prompted. They asked for picture ID upon check-in, which I produced and it was promptly whisked away and photocopied. The copy was stapled to my registration card. I indicated that I expected to get that back upon check-out and was told that that was not going to happen. When I did check out, the same surly woman refused to give the woman in line ahead of me her photocopied drivers license and the woman simply left unhappy. I asked for mine, was refused, and so I ripped it off my registration card. The clerk YELLED for the manager. The manager said she wasn't going to physically force me to give it back (!) but that I would be expected to comply with this policy if I stayed there again. Well of course I'm not staying there again. Copies of my identification don't belong in the hands of third-rate hotel clerks, or in anybody else's hands. I was told the policy was particular to this Ramada and not Ramada-wide, and that it originally had something to do with the war on terrorism. Oh brother. I felt like I was staying in a welfare flophouse. Maybe I was, maybe that's the market Ramada's after.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nanaimobum
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for four nights in mid November. The room was completly renovated, new furniture and bathroom fixtures. The hotel is close to everything, lots of great restaurants on the street, bus stop at the front door...great coffee at the onsite restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Good renovations”
Reviews.Author: Meanher
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay here due to the nearby car rental office and easy cab to the airport. The room allocated to us was very clean and had recently been renovated. We had a view of the back carpark but we didnt think it too bad as we only stayed one night. The restaurant and room sevice were very good and staff very friendly. There are plenty of other food outlets nearby so you have plenty of choices of where and what to eat. Reasonable room rates make this hotel a comeback to hotel. Their recent renovations hopefully, will include a good coat of paint on the outside. I think this hotel was good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Early bird, GETS OCEAN VIEW”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Tip: Make sure you check in as early as you can. We were unable to and they were out of rooms with ocean views. Half of the rooms face the ocean and the other half are facing the alley! Anyways, the balconies are the highlights for this place. Not many places feature this so that's a big plus.

HotelInfo.Name: Park Inn & Suites by Radisson on Broadway
HotelInfo.Address: 898 West Broadway, Vancouver, British Columbia V5Z 1J8, Canada
